pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:5.1: 20. The second training rule on swaying the head
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:6.3: At that time the monks from the group of six were swaying their heads and resting them on supports while sitting in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:7.1: “‘I will not sway my head while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:8.1: Sitting in an inhabited area, one should not sway one’s head;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:8.2: one should sit keeping the head straight.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:8.3: If a monk, out of disrespect, sways his head and rests it on a support while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:10.1: The tenth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk20:10.2: The second chapter on laughing loudly is finished.
